text: Vladimir Vasilievich Krishtopa (; born April 6, 1973 in Krasnivka, Ukrainian SSR) is a Ukrainian-born Russian serial killer and rapist. == Crimes == === First murder=== On June 17, 1995, Krishtopa, in a state of intoxication, attacked a woman on the staircase between the 6th and 7th floors of the No. 70 House on Orbitalnaya Street in Rostov-on-Don. The woman was raped by him, and then severely beaten. As a result of the beating, she died from a closed craniocerebral injury. File:Орбитальная ул., д. 70 (Ростов-на- Дону).jpg|Orbitalnaya St., 70, the site of the first murder. File:Орбитальная 70, 5-й подъезд.jpg|The stairwell where the first murder was committed. File:Орбитальная 70, 5-й подъезд, площадка между 6 и 7 этажами.JPG|The staircase where the first murder was committed. === Second murder === A month later, on July 21, Krishtopa, again intoxicated, committed another murder, raping the woman before strangling her. He then stole her cassette player without the headphones. File:Космонавтов, 18 (Ростов-на-Дону).JPG|Kosmonavtov St., 18, the site of the second murder. It was committed in the rightmost stairwell. File:Космонавтов, 18, 4-й подъезд, площадка между 6 и 7 этажами.JPG|The staircase where the second murder was committed. === Third murder attempt=== Krishtopa did not commit any more crimes until August 3, when he was detained for attempting to kill a third woman. During the search, authorities found the audio player, which served as a crucial evidence. File:Космонавтов, 21 (Ростов-на-Дону).JPG|Kosmonavtov St., 21, the site of the third and last murder attempt. File:Космонавтов, 21, 8-й этаж, выход из лифта.JPG|Elevator exit at 7th floor, the site where Krishtopa attacked his first victim, beating her unconscious. File:Космонавтов, 21, 8-й этаж, балкон.JPG|7th-floor balcony where Krishtopa dragged his unconscious victim. File:Космонавтов, 21, 8-й этаж, лестничная площадка.JPG|The 7-th floor staircase, the site where Krishtopa attempted the rape and the murder of his last victim. File:Комарова, 63 (Ростов-на-Дону).jpg|Komarova St., 34. The house where Krishopa was arrested. On March 21, 1996, the Rostov Regional Court judge Mikhail Rebrov sentenced Vladimir Krishtopa to execution by firing squad. But soon, a moratorium was imposed on its application, and the criminal who was already on death row in Novocherkassk was resentenced to 25 years in prison. When Krishtopa was in cell number 117 of the Novocherkassk prison, his neighbor was another notorious serial killer who operated at the same time - Vladimir Mukhankin.
